program: Master of Science in Biomedical Engineering (MS)

sections.text: Brown’s Biomedical Engineering MS provides advanced interdisciplinary training at the interface of engineering, biology, and medicine.

items: Electives in tissue engineering, biomaterials, imaging, and biomechanics
sections.text: Students combine core and elective courses with laboratory or design research to advance biomedical innovation.

items: Bachelor’s degree in engineering, physical sciences, or life sciences
sections.text: Admission requires a strong foundation in engineering or sciences, academic references, and a demonstrated commitment to biomedical research.
Graduates pursue careers in biotech, medical devices, or continue into PhD programs.
